Comments_List: I learnt about coding applied to phylogenetics

I feel like I didnt know anything about this material before the course, and Ive learned so much about pros and cons of certain methods, and various types of questions that can be asked. And new programs!
I learned methods to study language and cultural evolution. I learned how to apply Bayesian phylogenetic methods.
I think there was perhaps too much emphasis put on quantitative methods and that some prior exposure to computer science helped - both things were not very clear from the syllabus.

I really like that Claire will give an honest overview about a topic, giving pros and cons and making us aware of different perspectives and opinions. I walk away not only with knowledge about the material, but also an idea of the history and conversation about the topic. There was a lot in the course, so I sometimes felt overwhelmed. The readings on canvas and the classes didnt match up so I was a bit unsure about what I was supposed to read when. But the readings were helpful, and the class was very interesting.

Super useful and interesting course! I learned a lot of things that I think will be useful and I'd like to learn more about. I'm very happy that the lecture on  BEUTi and BEAST (and related programs) was recorded. It made some things much more doable than they would otherwise have been.  

The learning curve for the various programs was a bit uneven and it took some time to get things working. Sections were very helpful.
Yes, it's a good class to get acquainted with phylogenetics methods
Yes. I think it was very interesting.
Yes. I learned a lot of useful things in this course.
